How to use flybrid

1. A <table> with a <tbody>

A flybrid table is just a simple <table> element with the .flybrid class added to it, a width value of 100%, and a <tbody> element added inside to wrap the table's rows and columns (don't forget!). There's no need for addional <div> elements, conditional code (well, only a tiny bit, for special cases), and no complex CSS rules to write.

2. Use <th> for cells

Each cell in a flybrid table must be a <th> element, instead of the usual <td>. This is to make the stock email client on Android 4.4 (KitKat) devices respect overrides of the display CSS attribute.

3. 'Double-declare' widths for each cell

Use pixel widths values, and declare the width using the width attribute on each <th> AND apply the same width in CSS using the style attribute.

The width attribute value is for the less capable email clients, and will work while the table structure is still intact. The style value will be used when the table structure breaks down, and the cells become inline-block elements. It also helps columns resize properly in Outlook's 120 DPI mode

4. Extra steps required for cells wider than 300px

For wider columns, extra work is needed to ensure the column shrinks down to match the viewport size on smaller mobile devices. Simply adding style="width:100%; max-width:XXXpx" (where XXX is the width of your column) isn't enough because, with flybrid, the same <th> elements needs to remain the correct width in Outlook/Outlook.com/Office365, and that seems to create inconsistent results.

The solution is to use conditional comments to show one opening <th> tag to Outlook et al, and another to other browsers.

For example, if your column is 400px wide, you'd replace your opening tag with the following:

<!--[if (gte mso 9)|(IE)]><th width="400" style="width:400px;"><!--><th width="400" style="width:100%; max-width:400px;"><!--<![endif]-->

For further examples, view the source for examples C1), C2), D) or E) below.

5. Avoid padding at <th> level

You can expect strange results if you try to add padding the <th> cells of a flybrid table. If you want to add padding to your columns, you should use a nested table (see examples below) or add spacing some other way.

6. Eliminate all gaps between <th> & <tr> elements

A bug introduced in Apple's Mail app in iOS9 means that you need to eliminate any space between the opening and closing <th> & <tr> elements within your flybrid table. If not, the Mail app will add additional spacing between cells, force them to stack, even when the viewport is wide enough to display the desktop layout.

7. Flybrid plays nicely alongside other fluid-hybrid techniques

If you're using a fluid-hybrid approach in your template, adding flybrid to that template project should be a peice of cake. You just need to add the styles from _flybrid.less, use the examples below for guidance, and you should be good to go.
A1) 2 equal-width columns

Praesent dapibus, neque id cursus faucibus, tortor neque egestas.

Praesent dapibus, neque id cursus faucibus, tortor neque egestas.
A2) 2 equal-width columns (text only)

Praesent dapibus, neque id cursus faucibus, tortor neque egestas.

Praesent dapibus, neque id cursus faucibus, tortor neque egestas.
B) 2 equal-width columns (inset)

Donec nec justo eget felis facilisis fermentum. Aliquam porttitor.

Donec nec justo eget felis facilisis fermentum. Aliquam porttitor.
C1) 2 uneven sized columns

Aliquam tincidunt mauris eu risus auctor dapibus

Integer vitae libero
C2) 2 uneven sized columns (text only)

Aliquam tincidunt mauris eu risus auctor dapibus

Integer vitae libero
D) 2 uneven sized columns (inset)

Aliquam tincidunt mauris eu risus auctor dapibus

Integer vitae libero
E) 2 uneven sized columns (inset, column order reversed)

Aliquam tincidunt mauris eu risus auctor dapibus

Integer vitae libero
F1) 3 equal-width columns

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor
F2) 3 equal-width columns (text-only)

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor
G) 3 equal-width columns (inset)

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor
H) 3 equal-width columns (inset, multiple rows)

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor

Vestibulum felis commodo quis tortor
